message:
Asynchronous code is the ideal way to solve your problem. StartNew (or Run) will consume one extra thread per request.

At the very least, I'd use asynchronous code for the WebAPI calls, and wrap them in a Task.WhenAll and then block on that. That way you're only consuming one extra thread for all of the requests combined.

That said, if you're fine consuming extra threads, then there isn't a need to change the current code.
